meanings.definition: A unit of measurement of the refractive power of a lens.
meanings.sent1: She needed glasses with more dioptres to see clearly.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist prescribed lenses with three dioptres for her nearsightedness.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's glasses had so many dioptres that he could see through walls!
meanings.sent4: Her vision was like a camera lens, adjusting its dioptres to focus on different distances.
meanings.sent5: The concept of dioptres became crystal clear to her after the eye exam.

meanings.definition: The reciprocal of the focal length of a lens in meters.
meanings.sent1: The camera lens had a dioptres value of 0.5.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often adjust the dioptres to achieve the desired focus.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved manipulating the dioptres of the lens to create illusions.
meanings.sent4: His understanding of the world changed when he viewed it through different dioptres.
meanings.sent5: The telescope's dioptres allowed him to see distant galaxies with clarity.
